title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description:
Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
Created attachment 25997 [details] - NioEndpoint.java and simple web application
Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100%, and stays at 100% until the server is restarted. Reproduced with Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. It is a duplicate of issue: Bug 46373. It seems that Jetty guys fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel. I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: With this logging, we can see that selector.select(timeout) sometimes returns zero keys on the Linux platform.
EB: The server's CPU should not reach 100% and remain at 100% indefinitely. The issue should not be reproduced on the Windows platform.
SR:
1. Apply the attached patch to NioEndpoint.java (found in NioEndpoint.7z).
2. Deploy the patched NioEndpoint.java.
3. Use the provided simple web application (web.7z) to trigger server operations.
4. Observe the server's CPU usage on a Linux platform, noting any instances where it reaches 100% and remains at 100%. Also, verify that the issue is not reproduced on a Windows platform.
